7th Grade Computer Science

Session 3: HTML Review

September 1st and 2nd

Goals: Today we will review HTML and set our trajectory for the website unit.

Agenda

1. Listened to a mini-review on how to set up Text Wrangler, view an HTML file as a website, and basic HTML syntax.

2. Edited Sophie's HTML template to make it your own.

3. Brainstormed and interviewed each other about what makes a professional website.

Here is what we came up with:

Criteria of a professional website

  • Organized
    • Multiple pages which link to each other
    • Consistent style for all pages
  • Looks good
    • Colorful but not distracting, has a color scheme
    • Simple but elegant
    • Has relevant pictures
  • Easy to use
    • Design is intuitive
    • There are no glitches such as non-functioning links or missing images
    • Text is readable
    • No spelling or grammar errors
  • Good content
    • Content is relevant to website topic
    • Useful
    • Something you are proud of

Debrief

The final project for this unit will be to create professional Entre websites. Therefore, we want to work on ...

  • Adding consistent style to webpages
  • Organizing websites with multiple webpages
  • Creating complete websites with meaningful content

I also want to share the helpful feedback that I received from you and respond to some of your ideas. My responses are in italics.

You liked ...

  • Showing your personality. For our next project you will get to choose the topic of your website.
  • The "freedom of playing around in HTML". Lots more of this heading your way!
  • Having a template to work from.

You thought that in the future, it would be great if ...

  • Work time was quieter. Let's all be more aware of how much noise we're making during class and ensure that everyone can work productively. I'm also going to dedicate a portion of the room as a quiet working space. More on this next time.
  • Instructions were clear and displayed somewhere.
  • More time for activities. Unfortunately, there is only so much we can do in 90 minutes. Stop by at OH for more CS!
  • More time for a break. Please help me remember to give you a break during the block.
